00040 template <unsigned SIZE>
00041 struct BID
00042 {
00043     enum
00044     {
00045         size = SIZE,         
00046         t_size = SIZE        
00047     };
00048     file * storage;          
00049     int64_t offset;     
00050     BID() : storage(NULL), offset(0) { }
00051     bool valid() const
00052     {
00053         return storage;
00054     }
00055     BID(file * s, int64_t o) : storage(s), offset(o) { }
00056     BID(const BID & obj) : storage(obj.storage), offset(obj.offset) { }
00057     template <unsigned BlockSize>
00058     explicit BID(const BID<BlockSize> & obj) : storage(obj.storage), offset(obj.offset) { }
00059 };
00060 
00061 
00063 
00065 template <>
00066 struct BID<0>
00067 {
00068     file * storage;          
00069     int64_t offset;     
00070     unsigned size;           
00071     enum
00072     {
00073         t_size = 0           
00074     };
00075     BID() : storage(NULL), offset(0), size(0) { }
00076     BID(file * f, int64_t o, unsigned s) : storage(f), offset(o), size(s) { }
00077     bool valid() const
00078     {
00079         return storage;
00080     }
00081 };
00082 
00083 template <unsigned blk_sz>
00084 bool operator == (const BID<blk_sz> & a, const BID<blk_sz> & b)
00085 {
00086     return (a.storage == b.storage) && (a.offset == b.offset) && (a.size == b.size);
00087 }
00088 
00089 template <unsigned blk_sz>
00090 bool operator != (const BID<blk_sz> & a, const BID<blk_sz> & b)
00091 {
00092     return (a.storage != b.storage) || (a.offset != b.offset) || (a.size != b.size);
00093 }
00094 
00095 
00096 template <unsigned blk_sz>
00097 std::ostream & operator << (std::ostream & s, const BID<blk_sz> & bid)
00098 {
00099     s << " storage file addr: " << bid.storage;
00100     s << " offset: " << bid.offset;
00101     s << " size: " << bid.size;
00102     return s;
00103 }

00126 template <class T, unsigned Size_>
00127 class element_block
00128 {
00129 public:
00130     typedef T type;
00131     typedef T value_type;
00132     typedef T & reference;
00133     typedef const T & const_reference;
00134     typedef type * pointer;
00135     typedef pointer iterator;
00136     typedef const type * const_iterator;
00137 
00138     enum
00139     {
00140         size = Size_ 
00141     };
00142 
00144     T elem[size];
00145 
00146     element_block() {}
00147 
00149     reference operator [] (int i)
00150     {
00151         return elem[i];
00152     }
00153 
00155     iterator begin()
00156     {
00157         return elem;
00158     }
00160     const_iterator begin() const
00161     {
00162         return elem;
00163     }
00165     const_iterator cbegin() const
00166     {
00167         return begin();
00168     }
00170     iterator end()
00171     {
00172         return elem + size;
00173     }
00175     const_iterator end() const
00176     {
00177         return elem + size;
00178     }
00180     const_iterator cend() const
00181     {
00182         return end();
00183     }
00184 };

00226 class block_w_info :
00227             public block_w_bids<T_, ((RawSize_ - sizeof(BID<RawSize_>) * NBids_ - sizeof(InfoType_)) / sizeof(T_)), RawSize_, NBids_>
00228 {
00229 public:
00231     typedef InfoType_ info_type;
00232 
00234     info_type info;
00235

00242 template <class T_, unsigned RawSize_, unsigned NBids_>
00243 class block_w_info<T_, RawSize_, NBids_, void>:
00244             public block_w_bids<T_, ((RawSize_ - sizeof(BID<RawSize_>) * NBids_) / sizeof(T_)), RawSize_, NBids_>
00245 {
00246 public:
00247     typedef void info_type;
00248     enum { size = ((RawSize_ - sizeof(BID<RawSize_>) * NBids_) / sizeof(T_)) };
00249

00253 
00254 template <size_t ALIGNMENT>
00255 inline void * aligned_alloc(size_t size, size_t meta_info_size = 0)
00256 {
00257     char * buffer = new char[size + ALIGNMENT + sizeof(char *) + meta_info_size];
00258     memset(buffer, 0, size + ALIGNMENT + sizeof(char *) + meta_info_size);
00259     char * reserve_buffer = buffer + sizeof(char *) + meta_info_size;
00260     char * result = reserve_buffer + ALIGNMENT -
00261                     (((unsigned long)reserve_buffer) % (ALIGNMENT)) - meta_info_size;
00262     assert(int(result - buffer) >= int(sizeof(char *)));
00263     *(((char **)result) - 1) = buffer;
00264 
00265     return result;
00266 }
00267 
00268 template <size_t ALIGNMENT>
00269 inline void aligned_dealloc(void * ptr)
00270 {
00271     delete[] * (((char **)ptr) - 1);
00272 }

00289 template <unsigned RawSize_, class T_, unsigned NRef_ = 0, class InfoType_ = void>
00290 class typed_block :
00291             public block_w_info<T_, RawSize_, NRef_, InfoType_>,
00292             public filler_struct__<(RawSize_ - sizeof(block_w_info<T_, RawSize_, NRef_, InfoType_>))>
00293 {
00294 public:
00295     typedef T_ type;
00296     typedef T_ value_type;
00297     typedef T_ & reference;
00298     typedef const T_ & const_reference;
00299     typedef type * pointer;
00300     typedef pointer iterator;
00301     typedef type const * const_iterator;
00302 
00303     enum { has_filler = (RawSize_ != sizeof(block_w_info<T_, RawSize_, NRef_, InfoType_>)) };
00304 
00305     typedef BID<RawSize_> bid_type;
00306 
00307     typed_block() {}
00308 
00309     enum
00310     {
00311         raw_size = RawSize_,                                      
00312         size = block_w_info<T_, RawSize_, NRef_, InfoType_>::size 
00313     };
00314 
00320     request_ptr write(const BID<raw_size> & bid,
00321                       completion_handler on_cmpl = default_completion_handler())
00322     {
00323         return bid.storage->awrite(this,bid.offset,raw_size,on_cmpl);
00324     }
00325 
00331     request_ptr read(const BID<raw_size> & bid,
00332                      completion_handler on_cmpl = default_completion_handler())
00333     {
00334         return bid.storage->aread(this, bid.offset, raw_size, on_cmpl);
00335     }
00336 
00337     static void * operator new[] (size_t bytes)
00338     {
00339         unsigned_type meta_info_size = bytes % raw_size;
00340 
00341         void * result = aligned_alloc<BLOCK_ALIGN>(bytes, meta_info_size);
00342         memset(result, 0, bytes);
00343         char * tmp = (char *)result;
00344         tmp += RawSize_;
00345         while (tmp < ((char *)result) + bytes)
00346         {
00347             tmp += RawSize_;
00348         }
00349         return result;
00350     }
00351 
00352     static void * operator new (size_t bytes)
00353     {
00354         unsigned_type meta_info_size = bytes % raw_size;
00355 
00356         void * result = aligned_alloc<BLOCK_ALIGN>(bytes, meta_info_size);
00357         memset(result, 0, bytes);
00358         char * tmp = (char *)result;
00359         tmp += RawSize_;
00360         while (tmp < ((char *)result) + bytes)
00361         {
00362             tmp += RawSize_;
00363         }
00364         return result;
00365     }
00366 
00367     static void * operator new (size_t /*bytes*/, void * ptr)     // construct object in existing memory
00368     {
00369         return ptr;
00370     }
00371 
00372     static void operator delete[] (void * ptr)
00373     {
00374         aligned_dealloc<BLOCK_ALIGN>(ptr);
00375     }
00376 
00377     static void operator delete (void * ptr)
00378     {
00379         aligned_dealloc<BLOCK_ALIGN>(ptr);
00380     }
00381 
00382     static void operator delete (void *, void *)
00383     { }
00384 
00385     // STRANGE: implementing destructor makes g++ allocate
00386     // additional 4 bytes in the beginning of every array
00387     // of this type !? makes aligning to 4K boundaries difficult
00388     //
00389     // http://www.cc.gatech.edu/grads/j/Seung.Won.Jun/tips/pl/node4.html :
00390     // "One interesting thing is the array allocator requires more memory
00391     //  than the array size multiplied by the size of an element, by a
00392     //  difference of delta for metadata a compiler needs. It happens to
00393     //  be 8 bytes long in g++."
00394     // ~typed_block() { }
00395 };

00399 template <unsigned BLK_SIZE>
00400 class BIDArray : private boost::noncopyable
00401 {
00402 protected:
00403     unsigned_type _size;
00404     BID<BLK_SIZE> * array;
00405 
00406 public:
00407     typedef BID<BLK_SIZE> & reference;
00408     typedef BID<BLK_SIZE> * iterator;
00409     typedef const BID<BLK_SIZE> * const_iterator;
00410     BIDArray() : _size(0), array(NULL)
00411     { }
00412     iterator begin()
00413     {
00414         return array;
00415     }
00416     iterator end()
00417     {
00418         return array + _size;
00419     }
00420 
00421     BIDArray(unsigned_type size) : _size(size)
00422     {
00423         array = new BID<BLK_SIZE>[size];
00424     }
00425     unsigned_type size() const
00426     {
00427         return _size;
00428     }
00429     reference operator [] (int_type i)
00430     {
00431         return array[i];
00432     }
00433     void resize(unsigned_type newsize)
00434     {
00435         if (array)
00436         {
00437             BID<BLK_SIZE> * tmp = array;
00438             array = new BID<BLK_SIZE>[newsize];
00439             memcpy((void *)array, (void *)tmp,
00440                    sizeof(BID<BLK_SIZE>) * (std::min(_size, newsize)));
00441             delete[] tmp;
00442             _size = newsize;
00443         }
00444         else
00445         {
00446             array = new BID<BLK_SIZE>[newsize];
00447             _size = newsize;
00448         }
00449     }
00450     ~BIDArray()
00451     {
00452         if (array)
00453             delete[] array;
00454     }
00455 };

00457 
00458 class DiskAllocator : private boost::noncopyable
00459 {
00460     boost::mutex mutex;
00461 
00462     typedef std::pair<int64_t, int64_t> place;
00463     struct FirstFit : public std::binary_function<place, int64_t, bool>
00464     {
00465         bool operator () (const place & entry,const int64_t size) const
00466         {
00467             return (entry.second >= size);
00468         }
00469     };
00470     struct OffCmp
00471     {
00472         bool operator () (const int64_t & off1, const int64_t & off2)
00473         {
00474             return off1 < off2;
00475         }
00476     };
00477 
00478     DiskAllocator() { }
00479 
00480 protected:
00481     typedef std::map<int64_t, int64_t> sortseq;
00482     sortseq free_space;
00483     //  sortseq used_space;
00484     int64_t free_bytes;
00485     int64_t disk_bytes;
00486 
00487     void dump()
00488     {
00489         int64_t total = 0;
00490         sortseq::const_iterator cur = free_space.begin();
00491         for ( ; cur != free_space.end(); ++cur)
00492         {
00493             total += cur->second;
00494         }
00495     }
00496 
00497     void check_corruption(int64_t region_pos, int64_t region_size,
00498                           sortseq::iterator pred, sortseq::iterator succ)
00499     {
00500         if (pred != free_space.end())
00501         {
00502             if (pred->first <= region_pos && pred->first + pred->second > region_pos)
00503             {
00504                 std::ostringstream msg;
00505                 msg << "Error in DiskAllocator::check_corruption " << ": " << "Error: double deallocation of external memory " <<
00506                 "System info: P " << pred->first << " " << pred->second << " " << region_pos;
00507                 throw(std::runtime_error(msg.str()));
00508             }
00509         }
00510         if (succ != free_space.end())
00511         {
00512             if (region_pos <= succ->first && region_pos + region_size > succ->first)
00513             {
00514                 std::ostringstream msg;
00515                 msg << "Error in DiskAllocator::check_corruption " << ": " << "Error: double deallocation of external memory " <<
00516                 "System info: P " << region_pos << " " << region_size << " " << succ->first;
00517                 throw(std::runtime_error(msg.str()));
00518             }
00519         }
00520     }
00521 
00522 public:
00523     inline DiskAllocator(int64_t disk_size);
00524 
00525     inline int64_t get_free_bytes() const
00526     {
00527         return free_bytes;
00528     }
00529     inline int64_t get_used_bytes() const
00530     {
00531         return disk_bytes - free_bytes;
00532     }
00533     inline int64_t get_total_bytes() const
00534     {
00535         return disk_bytes;
00536     }
00537 
00538     template <unsigned BLK_SIZE>
00539     int64_t new_blocks(BIDArray<BLK_SIZE> & bids);
00540 
00541     template <unsigned BLK_SIZE>
00542     int64_t new_blocks(BID<BLK_SIZE> * begin,
00543                        BID<BLK_SIZE> * end);
00544 
00545     template <unsigned BLK_SIZE>
00546     void delete_block(const BID<BLK_SIZE> & bid);
00547 };
00548 
00549 DiskAllocator::DiskAllocator(int64_t disk_size) :
00550         free_bytes(disk_size),
00551         disk_bytes(disk_size)
00552 {
00553     free_space[0] = disk_size;
00554 }
00555 
00556 
00557 template <unsigned BLK_SIZE>
00558 int64_t DiskAllocator::new_blocks(BIDArray<BLK_SIZE> & bids)
00559 {
00560     return new_blocks(bids.begin(), bids.end());
00561 }
00562 
00563 template <unsigned BLK_SIZE>
00564 int64_t DiskAllocator::new_blocks(BID<BLK_SIZE> * begin,
00565                                   BID<BLK_SIZE> * end)
00566 {
00567     boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(mutex);
00568 
00569 
00570     int64_t requested_size = 0;
00571 
00572     typename BIDArray<BLK_SIZE>::iterator cur = begin;
00573     for ( ; cur != end; ++cur)
00574     {
00575         requested_size += cur->size;
00576     }
00577 
00578     if (free_bytes < requested_size)
00579     {
00580         begin->offset = disk_bytes; // allocate at the end
00581         for (++begin; begin != end; ++begin)
00582         {
00583             begin->offset = (begin - 1)->offset + (begin - 1)->size;
00584         }
00585         disk_bytes += requested_size;
00586 
00587         return disk_bytes;
00588     }
00589 
00590     // dump();
00591 
00592     sortseq::iterator space =
00593         std::find_if(free_space.begin(), free_space.end(),
00594                      bind2nd(FirstFit(), requested_size));
00595 
00596     if (space != free_space.end())
00597     {
00598         int64_t region_pos = (*space).first;
00599         int64_t region_size = (*space).second;
00600         free_space.erase(space);
00601         if (region_size > requested_size)
00602             free_space[region_pos + requested_size] = region_size - requested_size;
00603 
00604         begin->offset = region_pos;
00605         for (++begin; begin != end; ++begin)
00606         {
00607             begin->offset = (begin - 1)->offset + (begin - 1)->size;
00608         }
00609         free_bytes -= requested_size;
00610         //dump();
00611 
00612         return disk_bytes;
00613     }
00614 
00615     // no contiguous region found
00616     if (requested_size == BLK_SIZE)
00617     {
00618         assert(end - begin == 1);
00619 
00620         dump();
00621 
00622         begin->offset = disk_bytes; // allocate at the end
00623         disk_bytes += BLK_SIZE;
00624 
00625         return disk_bytes;
00626     }
00627 
00628     assert(requested_size > BLK_SIZE);
00629     assert(end - begin > 1);
00630 
00631     lock.unlock();
00632 
00633     typename  BIDArray<BLK_SIZE>::iterator middle = begin + ((end - begin) / 2);
00634     new_blocks(begin, middle);
00635     new_blocks(middle, end);
00636 
00637     return disk_bytes;
00638 }
00639 
00640 
00641 template <unsigned BLK_SIZE>
00642 void DiskAllocator::delete_block(const BID<BLK_SIZE> & bid)
00643 {
00644     boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(mutex);
00645 
00646     int64_t region_pos = bid.offset;
00647     int64_t region_size = bid.size;
00648     if (!free_space.empty())
00649     {
00650         sortseq::iterator succ = free_space.upper_bound(region_pos);
00651         sortseq::iterator pred = succ;
00652         pred--;
00653         check_corruption(region_pos, region_size, pred, succ);
00654         if (succ == free_space.end())
00655         {
00656             if (pred == free_space.end())
00657             {
00658                 dump();
00659                 assert(pred != free_space.end());
00660             }
00661             if ((*pred).first + (*pred).second == region_pos)
00662             {
00663                 // coalesce with predecessor
00664                 region_size += (*pred).second;
00665                 region_pos = (*pred).first;
00666                 free_space.erase(pred);
00667             }
00668         }
00669         else
00670         {
00671             if (free_space.size() > 1)
00672             {
00673                 bool succ_is_not_the_first = (succ != free_space.begin());
00674                 if ((*succ).first == region_pos + region_size)
00675                 {
00676                     // coalesce with successor
00677                     region_size += (*succ).second;
00678                     free_space.erase(succ);
00679                 }
00680                 if (succ_is_not_the_first)
00681                 {
00682                     if (pred == free_space.end())
00683                     {
00684                         dump();
00685                         assert(pred != free_space.end());
00686                     }
00687                     if ((*pred).first + (*pred).second == region_pos)
00688                     {
00689                         // coalesce with predecessor
00690                         region_size += (*pred).second;
00691                         region_pos = (*pred).first;
00692                         free_space.erase(pred);
00693                     }
00694                 }
00695             }
00696             else
00697             {
00698                 if ((*succ).first == region_pos + region_size)
00699                 {
00700                     // coalesce with successor
00701                     region_size += (*succ).second;
00702                     free_space.erase(succ);
00703                 }
00704             }
00705         }
00706     }
00707 
00708     free_space[region_pos] = region_size;
00709     free_bytes += int64_t(bid.size);
00710 
00711     //dump();
00712 }

00715 
00718 class block_manager : public singleton<block_manager>
00719 {
00720     friend class singleton<block_manager>;
00721 
00722     DiskAllocator * disk_allocator;
00723     file * disk_file;
00724 
00725     unsigned ndisks;
00726 
00727     block_manager() {}
00728 
00729 
00730 protected:
00731     template <class BIDType, class BIDIteratorClass>
00732     void new_blocks_int(const unsigned_type nblocks,BIDIteratorClass out);
00733 
00734 public:
00735     void init(const char* path, int64_t disk_size = 1000 * 1024 * 1024)
00736     {
00737         disk_file = new boostfd_file(path,file::CREAT | file::RDWR | file::DIRECT);
00738         disk_file->set_size(disk_size);
00739         disk_allocator = new DiskAllocator(disk_size);
00740     }
00741 
00743 
00750     template <class BIDIteratorClass>
00751     void new_blocks(BIDIteratorClass bidbegin,BIDIteratorClass bidend);
00752 
00761     template <class BlockType, class BIDIteratorClass>
00762     void new_blocks(const unsigned_type nblocks,BIDIteratorClass out);
00763 
00764 
00766 
00770     template <class BIDIteratorClass>
00771     void delete_blocks(const BIDIteratorClass & bidbegin, const BIDIteratorClass & bidend);
00772 
00775     template <unsigned BLK_SIZE>
00776     void delete_block(const BID<BLK_SIZE> & bid);
00777 
00778     ~block_manager()
00779     {
00780         delete disk_allocator;
00781         delete disk_file;
00782     }
00783 };
00784 
00785 
00786 template <class BIDType, class OutputIterator>
00787 void block_manager::new_blocks_int(const unsigned_type nblocks,OutputIterator out)
00788 {
00789     typedef BIDType bid_type;
00790     typedef BIDArray<bid_type::t_size> bid_array_type;
00791 
00792     bid_array_type disk_bid;
00793 
00794     unsigned_type i = 0;
00795 
00796     disk_bid.resize(nblocks);
00797     const int64_t old_capacity = disk_allocator->get_total_bytes();
00798     const int64_t new_capacity = disk_allocator->new_blocks(disk_bid);
00799     if (old_capacity != new_capacity)
00800     {
00801         // resize the file
00802         disk_file->set_size(new_capacity);
00803         if (new_capacity != disk_allocator->get_total_bytes())
00804             cout<<"File resizing failed: actual size " << disk_allocator->get_total_bytes() << " != requested size " << new_capacity<<endl;
00805     }
00806 
00807     OutputIterator it = out;
00808     for (i = 0; i != nblocks; ++it, ++i)
00809     {
00810         bid_type bid(disk_file, disk_bid[i].offset);
00811         *it = bid;
00812     }
00813 
00814 }
00815 
00816 template <class BlockType, class OutputIterator>
00817 void block_manager::new_blocks(const unsigned_type nblocks,OutputIterator out)
00818 {
00819     typedef typename BlockType::bid_type bid_type;
00820     new_blocks_int<bid_type>(nblocks, out);
00821 }
00822 
00823 template <class BIDIteratorClass>
00824 void block_manager::new_blocks(BIDIteratorClass bidbegin,BIDIteratorClass bidend)
00825 {
00826     typedef typename std::iterator_traits<BIDIteratorClass>::value_type bid_type;
00827 
00828     unsigned_type nblocks = 0;
00829 
00830     BIDIteratorClass bidbegin_copy(bidbegin);
00831     while (bidbegin_copy != bidend)
00832     {
00833         ++bidbegin_copy;
00834         ++nblocks;
00835     }
00836 
00837     new_blocks_int<bid_type>(nblocks, bidbegin);
00838 }
00839 
00840 
00841 template <unsigned BLK_SIZE>
00842 void block_manager::delete_block(const BID<BLK_SIZE> & bid)
00843 {
00844     disk_allocator->delete_block(bid);
00845     disk_file->delete_region(bid.offset, bid.size);
00846 }
00847 
00848 
00849 template <class BIDIteratorClass>
00850 void block_manager::delete_blocks(
00851     const BIDIteratorClass & bidbegin,
00852     const BIDIteratorClass & bidend)
00853 {
00854     for (BIDIteratorClass it = bidbegin; it != bidend; it++)
00855     {
00856         delete_block(*it);
00857     }
00858 }
00859 
00860 
00861 // in bytes
00862 #ifndef DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE
00863 #define DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE(type) (2 * 1024 * 1024) // use traits
00864 #endif

00866 NS_IZENELIB_AM_END
00867 
00868 
00869 #endif
